KH.linkedContent: Heidegger: chaos, khaos, khaine, signifies the yawning, a split in two, close connection to aletheia, abyss which opens

KH.linkedContent: for Nietzsche, Chaos prevents a humanization (Vermenschung) of existence in its totality

MONL.content: “sovereign establishment (mise en demeure souveraine) [sovereign summons]… disguised under alibis of ‘universal’ humanism”
MONL.linkedContent: “sovereign establishment (mise en demeure souveraine) [sovereign summons]… disguised under alibis of ‘universal’ humanism”

FK.content: from kenotic horizon of death of God to rights of human life (anthropological re-immanentization): an Abraham who would refuse to sacrifice his son and no longer envisage what was always madness [Pope speaks only of a certain “death of God”]
FK.linkedContent: from kenotic horizon of death of God to rights of human life (anthropological re-immanentization): an Abraham who would refuse to sacrifice his son and no longer envisage what was always madness [Pope speaks only of a certain “death of God”]

FK.content: humanitarian must keep peace, search for salvation, in new alliance btwn tele-technoscientific and 2 sources of religion: 1) the holy, unscathed 2) faith, fiduciary on the other

SPOM.linkedContent: messianicity w/out messianism distinguished from “an idea of” democracy, from law or right, even human rights

SPOM.content: where determined concept of man finished > là l’humanité pure de l’homme, de l’autre homme et de l’homme comme autre commence ou a enfin la chance de s’annoncer—de se promettre > in an inhuman or a-human fashion
SPOM.linkedContent: where determined concept of man finished > là l’humanité pure de l’homme, de l’autre homme et de l’homme comme autre commence ou a enfin la chance de s’annoncer—de se promettre > in an inhuman or a-human fashion

SPOM.linkedContent: Derrida admits that the right’s stance on the hypocrisy of what’s called humanitarian should be saluted, while remaining vigilantly on guard for its manipulations

SPOM.content: humanity: collection or series of ghosts
SPOM.linkedContent: humanity: collection or series of ghosts

SPOM.content: man, most unheimlich of all ghosts, if Christ (absolute specter) causes fear and pain, man causes even more—man makes himself fear (se fait peur), becomes fear he inspires > thus contradictions of all humanism
SPOM.linkedContent: man, most unheimlich of all ghosts, if Christ (absolute specter) causes fear and pain, man causes even more—man makes himself fear (se fait peur), becomes fear he inspires > thus contradictions of all humanism

A.content: absolute arrivant makes possible everything (starting w/ humanity of man) it cannot be reduced to
A.linkedContent: absolute arrivant makes possible everything (starting w/ humanity of man) it cannot be reduced to

A.content: Heidegger refuses to use word universal even though his existential analysis of death wants to be (universal too humanistic for Heidegger, too dependent on Aufklärung)
A.linkedContent: Heidegger refuses to use word universal even though his existential analysis of death wants to be (universal too humanistic for Heidegger, too dependent on Aufklärung)

EM.content: Sartre countersigned Corbin’s monstrous translation of Dasein: “réalité-humaine” > w/ Sartre and others of this period, concept of man is never examined
EM.linkedContent: Sartre countersigned Corbin’s monstrous translation of Dasein: “réalité-humaine” > w/ Sartre and others of this period, concept of man is never examined

EM.content: Sartre’s “metaphysical,” distinguished from phenomenological ontology which described essential specificity of regions, a purportedly neutral/undetermined unity of Being in-itself and Being for-itself > nothing other than unity of man and God: project of becoming God as the project constituting human-reality (atheism changes nothing); Sartre verifies Heidegger’s assessment “every humanism remains metaphysical,” ontotheological [see p. 118 (140n)]
EM.linkedContent: Sartre’s “metaphysical,” distinguished from phenomenological ontology which described essential specificity of regions, a purportedly neutral/undetermined unity of Being in-itself and Being for-itself > nothing other than unity of man and God: project of becoming God as the project constituting human-reality (atheism changes nothing); Sartre verifies Heidegger’s assessment “every humanism remains metaphysical,” ontotheological [see p. 118 (140n)]

EM.content: question of humanism contemporary w/ spellbinding (fascinante) extension of “human sciences” w/in philosophical field
EM.linkedContent: question of humanism contemporary w/ spellbinding (fascinante) extension of “human sciences” w/in philosophical field

EM.content: nous: assures proximity to itself of central being for which circular reappropriation is produced; nous: unity of absolute knowledge and anthropology, God & man, of onto-theo-teleology and humanism
EM.linkedContent: nous: assures proximity to itself of central being for which circular reappropriation is produced; nous: unity of absolute knowledge and anthropology, God & man, of onto-theo-teleology and humanism

EM.content: “l’être” et la langue est le nom de ce qui assure ce passage par le nous entre la métaphysique et l’humanisme
EM.linkedContent: “l’être” et la langue est le nom de ce qui assure ce passage par le nous entre la métaphysique et l’humanisme

EM.content: critique of empirical anthropologism affirmation of transcendental humanism (Husserl, Kant)

Heidegger’s radical questions re: humanism, his study of genesis of concept/value of “man” via Greek paideai in Rome, Christianizing of Latin humanitas, rebirth of Hellenism in 14th-18th centuries, makes secondary any metahumanist position not placed in his opening

EM.linkedContent: (154) for Heidegger, what is threatened in extension of metaphysics & technology is the essence of man, devastation of languages threat to essence of humanity

EM.content: Heidegger: humanism does not realize the proper dignity of man, does not set humanitas high enough
EM.linkedContent: Heidegger: humanism does not realize the proper dignity of man, does not set humanitas high enough

VM.content: Blanchot: preeminence of oral discourse, tranquil humanist, nearness to speaker
VM.linkedContent: Blanchot: preeminence of oral discourse, tranquil humanist, nearness to speaker

VM.content: humanism, separating man from animal, via analogy of God and human face [vis-à-vis Descartes, ambiguity of substance as concerns God and his creatures], is this not the original metaphor? Levinas’ metaphysical humanism
VM.linkedContent: humanism, separating man from animal, via analogy of God and human face [vis-à-vis Descartes, ambiguity of substance as concerns God and his creatures], is this not the original metaphor? Levinas’ metaphysical humanism

S.content: Heidegger’s discourse [on hand], all the more peremptory and authoritarian for hiding its discomfiture, preserves, sheltered in obscurity, the profoundest metaphysical humanism
S.linkedContent: Heidegger’s discourse [on hand], all the more peremptory and authoritarian for hiding its discomfiture, preserves, sheltered in obscurity, the profoundest metaphysical humanism

S.content: price of the strategy of “spirit,” always turns back on “subject,” even when used to displace subject from racism, biologism, naturalism, the opposition requires a “unilaterality of subjectity,” an oppositional determination > whether “human rights” or democracy, freedom of spirit demarcates a metaphysics of subjectity that is blind to the irreducibility of complicity, contamination (even if, and there are, degrees)
S.linkedContent: price of the strategy of “spirit,” always turns back on “subject,” even when used to displace subject from racism, biologism, naturalism, the opposition requires a “unilaterality of subjectity,” an oppositional determination > whether “human rights” or democracy, freedom of spirit demarcates a metaphysics of subjectity that is blind to the irreducibility of complicity, contamination (even if, and there are, degrees)

S.content: though Derrida sees a “humanist teleology” in the hierarchization of man to animal (found in the negation imposed on animal w/ weltarm), one which requires not one ontology but the very possibility of the onto-logical, he isn’t criticizing it (it does denounce biologism, racism, and naturalism) > can we escape this program? can we transform it by “reconnoitering it right down to its most tortuous ruses and most subtle resources”?

OH.content: for Husserl, the European philosopher committed to universal reason is functionary of mankind
OH.linkedContent: for Husserl, the European philosopher committed to universal reason is functionary of mankind

TC.content: theater of cruelty measures limit of representation: man is a representation of life, humanism > instead, life is cruelty, the nonrepresentable origin of representation
TC.linkedContent: theater of cruelty measures limit of representation: man is a representation of life, humanism > instead, life is cruelty, the nonrepresentable origin of representation

FWT.content: how can one be opposed to the humanitarian ideal? it’s not even “political” [Schmitt], but must remain vigilant to humanitarian alibis, suspect policies instrumentalizing “human rights”
FWT.linkedContent: how can one be opposed to the humanitarian ideal? it’s not even “political” [Schmitt], but must remain vigilant to humanitarian alibis, suspect policies instrumentalizing “human rights”

FWT.content: DP, like death itself, what’s “proper to man” > DP, at risk of shocking, always answered deeply “humanist” pleas
FWT.linkedContent: DP, like death itself, what’s “proper to man” > DP, at risk of shocking, always answered deeply “humanist” pleas

FWT.content: psychoanalytic aim > not to seek refuge in a theological/humanist alibi > Derrida seduced by psychoanalysis’ audacity of thought, its courage, signing theoretical “fictions” in name of a knowledge w/out alibi (thus, the most “positive” knowledge”)
FWT.linkedContent: psychoanalytic aim > not to seek refuge in a theological/humanist alibi > Derrida seduced by psychoanalysis’ audacity of thought, its courage, signing theoretical “fictions” in name of a knowledge w/out alibi (thus, the most “positive” knowledge”)

POOF.content: for Schmitt, any discussion of humanity is outside the political: there is no enemy of humanity > enemy is always public
POOF.linkedContent: for Schmitt, any discussion of humanity is outside the political: there is no enemy of humanity > enemy is always public

POOF.content: Hugo: in the future, Paris will be the capital of what will be called Europe, which will be called Humanity—definitive nation, what a majestic vision!
POOF.linkedContent: Hugo: in the future, Paris will be the capital of what will be called Europe, which will be called Humanity—definitive nation, what a majestic vision!

POOF.content: Derrida explains how he does not want to exploit spectacular ‘news,’ that which screens out (fait écran) reflection [makes a screen of reflection], by projecting itself w/ pathetic, sensational, images of violence that are too easily mediatizable > yet, all these examples (immigration, globalization, new warfare) are in our mind & heart as Derrida strives to deconstruct fraternal link to friendship: how does humanitarian participate in fraternizing humanization?
POOF.linkedContent: Derrida explains how he does not want to exploit spectacular ‘news,’ that which screens out (fait écran) reflection [makes a screen of reflection], by projecting itself w/ pathetic, sensational, images of violence that are too easily mediatizable > yet, all these examples (immigration, globalization, new warfare) are in our mind & heart as Derrida strives to deconstruct fraternal link to friendship: how does humanitarian participate in fraternizing humanization?

POOF.content: the question “what is a crime against humanity?” is pregnant w/ a future whose monstrosity ne porte pas de nom ——from w/in fraternization, greatest crime is betrayal of humanity (fall short of virtue of fraternity), the supreme perjury: fratricide as radical evil, only the brother can be betrayed
POOF.linkedContent: the question “what is a crime against humanity?” is pregnant w/ a future whose monstrosity ne porte pas de nom ——from w/in fraternization, greatest crime is betrayal of humanity (fall short of virtue of fraternity), the supreme perjury: fratricide as radical evil, only the brother can be betrayed

POOF.content: via Kant, the deception linked to modesty is moral & egalitarian, creates distance btwn sexes, saves other from degradation, becoming-technical, instrumentalization of jouissance
POOF.linkedContent: via Kant, the deception linked to modesty is moral & egalitarian, creates distance btwn sexes, saves other from degradation, becoming-technical, instrumentalization of jouissance

POOF.content: modesty would get woman to participate in universal fraternity (i.e. humanity), equalizes sexes by moralizing them: modest woman is a brother for man
POOF.linkedContent: modesty would get woman to participate in universal fraternity (i.e. humanity), equalizes sexes by moralizing them: modest woman is a brother for man

POOF.content: woman doesn’t become any less desirable! modesty belongs to history qua fraternization
POOF.linkedContent: woman doesn’t become any less desirable! modesty belongs to history qua fraternization

POOF.content: for Kant, crime against humanity would be to disdain currency, to take counterfeit money for counterfeit [skeptic betrays mankind] > for Kant, virtue obligates that we turn counterfeit (small change) into gold, becoming-truth of the simulacrum, its verification, authentication [pp. 257-58 rare friend keeps secret, renounces possible public profit, that of circulating secret]
POOF.linkedContent: for Kant, crime against humanity would be to disdain currency, to take counterfeit money for counterfeit [skeptic betrays mankind] > for Kant, virtue obligates that we turn counterfeit (small change) into gold, becoming-truth of the simulacrum, its verification, authentication [pp. 257-58 rare friend keeps secret, renounces possible public profit, that of circulating secret]

POOF.content: for Nietzsche, if woman is not even part of humanity [via inability to befriend], man is not yet man either, men are equally late [Augustine], though woman lagging > be patient in the face of this ‘not yet’: mourned anticipation, a threshold naming—May we have it one day!
POOF.linkedContent: for Nietzsche, if woman is not even part of humanity [via inability to befriend], man is not yet man either, men are equally late [Augustine], though woman lagging > be patient in the face of this ‘not yet’: mourned anticipation, a threshold naming—May we have it one day!

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s Superman: awaited because he is origin/cause of man, Ursache, this friend promised via messianico-teleiopeotic perhaps, immemorially past > this friendship to come would still be too human, still deserves name ‘friendship’ [anthropological, humanist character of friendship is situated/delimited here, friendship of proximity/presence]
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s Superman: awaited because he is origin/cause of man, Ursache, this friend promised via messianico-teleiopeotic perhaps, immemorially past > this friendship to come would still be too human, still deserves name ‘friendship’ [anthropological, humanist character of friendship is situated/delimited here, friendship of proximity/presence]

POOF.content: for Zarathustra, humanity in default of an end also defaults itself (manque la fin se manque aussi elle-même) —is itself en manque d’humanité
POOF.linkedContent: for Zarathustra, humanity in default of an end also defaults itself (manque la fin se manque aussi elle-même) —is itself en manque d’humanité

POOF.content: who is the friend? beyond ego, presence, subject, etc.? distancing itself from all determinations? beyond the brother who capitalizes everything? > this a political question—will there be loud protests (by militants of a dogmatic humanism) if to think & live gentle rigor of friendship would be the law of friendship qua an experience of ahumanity?
POOF.linkedContent: who is the friend? beyond ego, presence, subject, etc.? distancing itself from all determinations? beyond the brother who capitalizes everything? > this a political question—will there be loud protests (by militants of a dogmatic humanism) if to think & live gentle rigor of friendship would be the law of friendship qua an experience of ahumanity?

P.linkedContent: hierarchy of art constituted on the analogical model of human language

P.content: [and yet] for Kant, “happiness & culture presuppose that man puts to work what nature puts at his disposal”; Critique depends on reflexive humanism, pragmatic anthropology: to differentiate errant (w/out objective end) beauty from adherent must be view toward final causes

ATIA.content: for Kant, “dignity” of man, his autonomy, his autotely, his capacity for moral autodestination (Selbstbestimmung), for moral autobiography > this is his privilege, assures Herrschaft
ATIA.linkedContent: for Kant, “dignity” of man, his autonomy, his autotely, his capacity for moral autodestination (Selbstbestimmung), for moral autobiography > this is his privilege, assures Herrschaft

FS.content: Derrida describes a hypocritical humanistic writing that imagines the will-to-write as an awakening of a freedom beyond affectivity: to write forgetting difference (finitude) in pure speech > could beauty then be distinguished from the letter itself? what about specificity?

DPi.linkedContent: irreconcilable axiomatics (humanism of Enlightenment & its opposite): reign of terror, DP, etc.—divide will continue “for a long time”

DPi.content: invention of guillotine not just any moment in history: French Revolution, declarations of rights of man, death of monarchy of divine right (pp. 196-97 guillotine will be democratic, egalitarian > this will be the spirit of its invention)

guillotine: [doesn’t erase or dry up blood but keeps it] withdraws hands of man

DPi.content: Society of Jesus & medical corporation at origin of “humanitarian machine”

DPi.content: Enlightenment concepts of guillotine not in contradiction w/ certain Christian humanism: the dignified, humanistic death; it is progressive: 1) egalitarian 2) individualist 3) mechanistic, machinisitic > only the machine can make everyone equal before the law

Gii.linkedContent: paradoxical/regular association of nationalism w/ cosmopolitanism, w/ humanism

Gii.linkedContent: for Fichte, “we” of Geschlecht, question of humanity (Menschlichkeit) (versus animality) > teleological essence of humanity announced par excellence in Deutschheit

Gii.linkedContent: profound link btwn Europocentric universalism, humanism & nationalism

PIO.linkedContent: invention always belonging to man, techno-epistemo-anthropocentric > invention’s value inscribed in structures that bind technical order w/ metaphysical humanism (differentially)

IW.linkedContent: Cohen: humanity of one’s home can become native soil (Mutterboden) of internationality, foundation of a spirit of peace

IW.content: for Fichte, conversely, nation is an ego > relates to itself via egological subjectivity
IW.linkedContent: for Fichte, conversely, nation is an ego > relates to itself via egological subjectivity

IW.content: truth of nationality is German idealism; the German spirit is the spirit of humanity

IW.linkedContent: Cohen suspects a narcissistic infatuation in Fichte’s national ego, mirror of a certain psyché, but also room for any other self in this national self, cosmopolitan logic, national self as “We”

LI.linkedContent: deconstruction of onto-theological humanism (of Heidegger too) > iterability of mark beyond all human speech acts

TN.linkedContent: hand, humanism, continuistic intuitionism, natural immediacy > so many celebrations of touching

AD.content: even if feminine alterity is “hospitable welcome par excellence,” even if she’s not a man, she remains human: woman w/out “height” of face, not most high: her familiarity accomplishes “the en-ergy of separation” [?]

CF.linkedContent: we are all heir to crimes against humanity, i.e. the revolutions that made this concept [human rights] possible

BSi.content: international rights & crimes against humanity invoke a sovereignty of man himself (ipse, ipsissimus) above/beyond/before Nation-State sovereignty (Schmitt sees this as Entpolitisierung, humanity not a political concept)
BSi.linkedContent: international rights & crimes against humanity invoke a sovereignty of man himself (ipse, ipsissimus) above/beyond/before Nation-State sovereignty (Schmitt sees this as Entpolitisierung, humanity not a political concept)

BSi.linkedContent: Schmitt: “concept of humanity” useful instrument of ideological expansion; Proudhon: whoever invokes humanity wants to cheat

BSi.content: for Schmitt, what’s terrifying (schrecklich) about a Nation’s pretentious appeal to “humanity” is how such a nation treats its enemy as hors la loi, hors l’humanité—treats them like beasts

BSi.content: Schmitt doesn’t like hypocrisy of humanistic allegation/alibi > unehrliche Fiktion (dishonest fiction) of total depoliticization, peace w/out States

BSi.content: Schmitt: war should speak its name: be honest, honorable (Ehre)

BSi.content: Schmitt argues [and Derrida doesn’t (entirely) disagree]: Left uses hugely murderous weapon of “humanitarian,” “humanistic”

BSi.content: anthropocentered, humanistic logic: sovereignty of Law, freedom, responsibility (response) opposed to animal fixity, program, imaginary, hard-wired, coded reaction

OG.content: for Rousseau, only Europe can be itself & everything else at same time [re: language/society], pedagogical success & ethnological humanism have good fortune to appear in Europe

OG.content: Derrida says Rousseau simply wrong for not using this universal opening en fait

UWC.content: mondialisation wishes to be a humanization (human rights, concept of what’s proper to man)

UWC.content: figure of humanist: a response to the question of work, the theology of work secularizes time > the clock sometimes represents an attribute of the humanist [14th century]

UWC.content: powerful juridical performatives shape modern history of humanity of man: “human rights,” “crimes against humanity”

FV.content: classical [mis]treatment of animal [eg. in Lacan] condenses system’s greatest obscurity: obscurantist resistance in history of (humanist/phallogocentric) metaphysics
FV.linkedContent: classical [mis]treatment of animal [eg. in Lacan] condenses system’s greatest obscurity: obscurantist resistance in history of (humanist/phallogocentric) metaphysics

FV.content: acc. Lacan, the [full] speech which constitutes/forms the subject is forbidden to him > it speaks everywhere it can be read in his Being [this antinomy is very antinomy of the meaning Freud gave to unconscious]: true speech always operates through mediation of another subject, it is open to chain w/out end re: speeches in which dialectic of recognition is concretely realized in human community [?]
